title: Doctors and Patients Should Decide Together
sub_head: Retreat and paternalism aren’t the only options for physicians.
body:
Kudos to Talya Miron-Shatz for illuminating the dark side of medical consumerism (“Can Patients Decide Their Own Care?” Review, Oct. 9). If physicians can’t or won’t use their specialized education, knowledge and experience to help patients make informed decisions, what role do they wish to play? Fortunately, there is a middle ground between this approach and medical paternalism: shared decision-making. Physicians share risks and benefits, and patients share values and preferences—resulting in a collaborative conclusion.
Jennifer Comerford
